name: The Ultimate Pride and Prejudice and Zombies Quiz | Authors

questions.text: After killing several of Lady Catherine's ninjas, Elizabeth Bennet cut out the heart of one of the ninjas and preceded to eat it. What country did Elizabeth tell Lady Catherine had the most tender hearts that she had ever eaten?
questions.explanation:
Japan.

	Lady Catherine dispatched several of her ninjas to fight Elizabeth. Quickly, Elizabeth killed all of Lady Catherine's ninjas and ate the heart of the last ninja she killed. Lady Catherine was appalled at Elizabeth for her actions.

questions.text: When Charlotte Lucas came to tell Elizabeth Bennet of her impending marriage, what other secret did Charlotte reveal to her best friend?
questions.correct: Charlotte had been bitten by a zombie
options: Charlotte had married Mr. Collins for the fortune he would one day have
Charlotte was pregnant with the child of a new zombie
Charlotte was in love with Mr. Darcy
questions.explanation:
Charlotte had been bitten by a zombie.

	After Mr. Collins proposed to Charlotte Lucas, she went to her best friend Elizabeth to tell her the news first. After revealing the marriage plans, Charlotte told Elizabeth that she had been bitten by a zombie the week before while on her way to visit the Bennet family. Charlotte begged Elizabeth not to tell anyone. She wanted to be married so her husband could give her a Christian burial.

questions.text: Mrs. Bennet wanted one of her daughters to marry the new owner of Netherfield Park, who just happened to have what last name?
questions.explanation:
Bingley.

	Mrs. Bennet had heard that the new owner of Netherfield Park was Mr. Bingley. She had also heard that Mr. Bingley was worth four to five thousand pounds a year. The youngest Bennet daughter, Lydia, thought that even though she was the youngest she was also the one sister who could entice Mr. Bingley. However, during a party thrown at Netherfield Park Mr. Bingley became smitten with the oldest Bennet daughter, Jane.

questions.text: Which one of the Bennet sisters was stabbed by a zombie while riding out to meet new friends for tea?
questions.explanation:
Jane.

	Mrs. Bennet refused to let Jane have the carriage and told her take a horse instead. While she was traveling to Netherfield Park, it began to rain and Jane was attacked by zombies. She fought them, but was bruised and stabbed in the altercation. Although the wound was minor, Jane was forced to stay at Netherfield Park until she was better. Elizabeth went to check on her and after her altercation with zombies she was asked to stay at Netherfield Park as well.

questions.text: "It is a truth universally acknowledged that a ______ in possession of brains must be in want of more brains" is the opening line of "Pride and Prejudice and Zombies". What is the missing word?
questions.explanation:
Zombie.

	Mr. Bennet only liked his daughter Lizzy because he thought she had a good head on her shoulders. Mr. Bennet believed it was his job to keep his daughters alive while Mrs. Bennet saw to it that they were married. Out of all the Bennet children, Mrs. Bennet liked Lizzy the least.

questions.text: Why did Mr. Darcy keep Mr. Bingley from spending time with Jane Bennet?
questions.correct: Mr. Darcy was afraid Jane had been infected by a zombie
options: Mr. Darcy secretly wanted Jane for himself
Mr. Darcy misinterpreted something Elizabeth said about Jane and Mr. Bingley
Mr. Darcy knew that Jane didn't love Mr. Bingley
questions.explanation:
Mr. Darcy was afraid Jane had been infected by a zombie

	Mr. Darcy kept Mr. Bingley away from Jane on purpose in case she had been changed into a zombie. Mr. Darcy didn't want Bingley to watch her go through the transformation only to kill her later when her transformation to a zombie was complete.

questions.text: Where did the Bennet sisters practice the deadly arts that they use to kill zombies?
questions.explanation:
China.

	The Bennet sisters practiced under Mr. Liu in China. He taught them how to shoot, throw daggers, and use a katana. Mr. Bennet hates Japan, which is why he sent his daughters to China to study.

questions.text: Which Bennet daughter did Mr. Wickham abscond with, whom he later had to marry for the daughter's sake?
questions.explanation:
Lydia Bennet.

	A lie was told that Mr. Wickham had been paralyzed in a carriage accident when Mr. Bennet's brother found Lydia and Wickham. In truth, Darcy beat him so badly that he paralyzed Wickham. Wickham told Mr. Bennet that he didn't want Lydia's money, but just a small payment for new linens since he was bedridden. Mr. Wickham was going to join St. Lazarus Seminary for the lame in Kilkenny, Ireland after he and Lydia were married.

questions.text: Out of Mr. Bennet's three sons-in-law, which one did he proclaim he liked the best?
options: Mr. Bennet proclaimed none of them to be better than his daughters
questions.explanation:
Mr. Wickham

	Mr. Bennet said that Wickham was his favorite son-in-law because he fidgeted the least. Mr. Wickham was permanently paralyzed and therefore could not move.

questions.text: Mr. Darcy's aunt, Lady Catherine de Bourgh, wanted Darcy and Elizabeth to be married because they made the perfect couple.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Lady Catherine didn't want Elizabeth marrying Darcy, because Catherine thought Elizabeth was beneath her nephew. They even fought in the Bennet dojo over it. Catherine wanted Darcy to marry her daughter, Ann.
